snippet.title: Jason Dundas opens up on this nude photo he didn't want anyone else to see
snippet.content:
Jason Dundas behind the scenes photo shoot for Holden 0:45
Highlight real of Jason Dundas in a behind the scenes photo shoot for Holden Credit: The White Tree
October 20th 2016 9 months ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Sport news and galleries/
"Clothes are overrated." Source Instagram
NUI TE KOHA
Share
TELEVISION presenter and model Jason Dundas has opened up about the vexing motivation behind his controversial nude selfie on social media. He said his naked selfie was a cheeky statement against the over-sexualised nature of social media.
The nude photo Jason Dundas didn't want anyone to see.Source:The Daily Telegraph "I jumped on the bandwagon to poke fun, but I started getting smashed with (direct messages) saying your account is about to be ripped down," he said. "Clothes are overrated. Little afternoon stretch in my yoga room," Dundas posted with a naked shot on Instagram earlier this year. An hour later, the post was deleted. Dundas told Confidential: "I've got this love-hate relationship with Instagram. Whenever I post things, I lose followers. When I don't post things, I gain followers. "I'm just so confused about it. And I'm so frustrated with people posting blatant sexuality that gets a huge following. I try to be honest, educate people, share experiences and be vulnerable.
Model Jason DundasSource:Getty Images Originally published as
